channel.title: PI Roll Backs
channel.description:
[b]Hello. Im kinda pissed off right now due to my server having a ton of issues.
Ive tryed to add netty framework to my server but the links to the deps on the tutorial are dead so I cant.
Im getting 13ms and avg 3% engine load using VPS.
How can I stop these roll backs, ive tryed doing the shutdown hook modifcation, netty, savetimer... pretty much everything.
Please could someone help me out. :confused:

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @JoeBenton2014 JoeBenton2014
item.description:
@JoeBenton2014 wrote:

[b]Done loads of things and there still happening. Anyone else got something?

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

i dont know what the variable is in PI, but whatever it is search savefile = false; (replace savefile with your variable) and one is probably in a catch clause. in that clause do a printStackTrace() and from there you should be able to figure out the issue, if it is an error causing it.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Another thing “Wrong” could be that your server is set up to kick a user after they have been logged in for x amount of time, it sounds stupid but some people make a kick timer. Check your process method in client.java and also Config.java for static variables that may be related.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @JoeBenton2014 JoeBenton2014
item.description:
@JoeBenton2014 wrote:

[b]Theres nothing coming up in cmd though, no nullpointerexceptions etc.

But the shutdown hook for when they disconnect doesnt seem to be working.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“JoeBenton2014, post:6, topic:540954”][b]In which directory mate? Ive seen this posted somewhere before, and never known a use of it

Thank you for posting though, Directory = ?[/quote]
Client.java process();
I was actually joking lol

If people are disconnecting, there something wrong with your packet handling (incomplete, bugged etc). Somebody might be clicking an object or NPC in game causing the server to disconnect (seen a few servers with that problem). You’re going to need to debug that.

As for the role backs, try save the player when they disconnect.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @JoeBenton2014 JoeBenton2014
item.description:
@JoeBenton2014 wrote:

[b]In which directory mate? Ive seen this posted somewhere before, and never known a use of it

Thank you for posting though, Directory = ?

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @JoeBenton2014 JoeBenton2014
item.description:
@JoeBenton2014 wrote:

[b]Well theres no errors in the cmd, ive re done the shutdown hook and put a prevention using server.java for mass save,

Its stopped them for most people but some are still having the odd dc and then rolling.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

When are the rollbacks occurring? Are you sure it’s because you’re not using netty?
Maybe there’s another issue in your server that’s unrelated.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Roll Backs
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Google for the project and download the most recent binaries?
